website_summaries.verdict: Very breathable and comfortable waders for the money.
pros: Includes wading belt and belt loops
Wide straps with adjustable chest rope
Keeps you warm and dry, but breathes enough to keep you from overheating
A stocking wader that allows you to use your fly fishing boots
cons: Sizing is a little non-specific and may be a challenge
Make sure you check the sizing chart closely before you buy

customer_reviews.title: Fits great except the stockingfeet....
customer_reviews.text: I thought I finally found "the" pair of waders that fit my body type. For the most part its true but the stocking feet are almost clown sized. I wear a size 11 wides and I bet these would fit a size 17 comfortably. Almost like clown shoe size. What gives? I'm going to return them (unfortunately, the rest of them seem decent and fit well) because i'm pretty sure I wouldn't be able to get them stuffed into wading boots. I can literally fold the stocking feet back over the front of my feet with ease, its almost comical. *ugh*
customer_reviews.author: Steve D. From MI

customer_reviews.title: Snug through the calf area.  Leaky boot after less than six uses.
customer_reviews.text: Liked these and decided to keep them. Haven't used them on the water yet. Tried them on over a pair of jeans. Work OK, but did notice they are snugger in the calf area than my old Cabela brand wader. I have now used these only a few times, less than half a dozen for sue. And always for less than 3 hours/use on a local creek. One of the boots is leaked and left my sock soaked on my use last weekend. This should not happen this soon. I won't buy this brand again. And I can't recommend it for anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Riley Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Size charts are wrong.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return these. They claim to be 64" girth on the XXL-Stout, but I am only 54"--I wanted them a little loose and they were so tight, I couldn't get into them. above my waist. I even tried wearing only shorts and a t-shirt, but they still didn't fit. Sorry Caddis, your size charts are way off.
customer_reviews.author: Lee D. Sudduth

customer_reviews.title: Pocket Not Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: While wading in the river and fly fishing, I tripped on some rocks and fell. Water got inside the waters including the front pocket. Not a huge amount of water, but enough to get my keys, flies, tools, wallet, and things a little wet. Good thing my iPhone 8 is water resistant!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Waders, Super Comfortable, Easy to Adjust
customer_reviews.text: These are good waders for the price. The don't leak at all. The pockets are located in convenient places. The crotch is really long and comfortable, so if you are sitting in a fishcat, you won't get a wedgie. Suspenders are nice and wide. The buckles haven't slipped and they are really easy to adjust while you are wearing them. If you aren't fishing and you sit in a chair, they don't run up your buttcrack. They are easy to walk in and flex good where they need to. The only con is the stocking foot is a little hard to get off compared to others I've worn.
customer_reviews.author: DesperadoTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Fits Well.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight yet sturdy. Have used several times now, and easy to get in and out of, no leaks and handy tool pockets as well. Hopefully will hold up to the mucky shore bottom we have. For a price that is 1/3 of what other waders cost, this was a great value. Ordered the Large, and it is roomy on me at 5'10, 185 pounds, medium build, and wear size 11.5-12 shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and Caddis customer service
customer_reviews.text: Giving 5-stars for now based on appearance and fit. If you are not certain about sizing, email Caddis and give them your height, weight, inseam and waist measurements. They will definitely get you into the waders that will fit you best. I originally ordered a medium which fit great except they were tight around my calves. After sending Caddis my measurements, they recommended a medium short stout. I returned the mediums and the MSS's are a great fit and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: JHJAX2012

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding! I went on my 2nd week long fishing trip to Montana. We hike and fish in rustic areas. Last time my waders fell apart in the 2nd day. I bout this one and it endures the entire week. I even fell in some rocks assuming they would of tore. These waders are tough and did an awesome job. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rgsteelers

customer_reviews.title: Leaked from day one!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these some time ago and used today for the first time. Left foot leaks like crazy. I am in 20 degree weather in a trout stream freezing my tail off. Spend the money for a good pair of waders avoid these at all costs. Of course my window to return these has closed so I am stuck with an inferior product. Beware these waders are no good.
customer_reviews.author: ray

customer_reviews.title: Great waders.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big guy...finding waders wasn't easy...let alone a deal like I received on these open box. I'm 6' 300lbs and the xxl stout are perfect. Legs fit my 30" inseam with room to spare, probably would accommodate a 34". The breathed well and worked perfectly through their inauguration.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 3 days.
customer_reviews.text: Sockeye fishing in Alaska. Leaked the third day. Didn't even last a week.
customer_reviews.author: Angela K. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Sizing just didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return. Went by size chart indicating I should order a men’s LG. At 5’11 and 195lbs, the girth was good, but when adjusted for proper chest height, the crotch and leg length was about 3-4”too long. I normally wear a 30-31” inseam.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K.

customer_reviews.title: Watertight
customer_reviews.text: 5 trips in and I these are a killer value, watertight, and comfortable in very cold water. I ordered the short/stout fit which fits my body type great. The foot pretty large, but still work fine. I wear US 10.5 shoe (that's large for my 5'8" height), but these waders were made to accommodate size 13 feet (I assume they just use 1 boot size for all fits because these fit NBA player feet).
customer_reviews.author: Cross

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I used them 23 days straight in saltwater and had no problems. I will recommend buying them since they are not that expensive and will last you. They have diff sizes which is great and dont have to spend $300-$500 on other waders which are similar to those. If I rip them on rocks I can fix them or get new pair and still save tons of $$$
customer_reviews.author: Tom757

customer_reviews.title: nice waders...good price
customer_reviews.text: I also bought the Mens pant waders...nice waders...inexpensive...I used them for salt wader fly fishing... use Caddis' website for sizing...don't listen to others on sizing...my first 2-3 attempts were way off based on what people suggested.  I was a small...bought one...but I think a medium is better so you can kneel down when you want too...
customer_reviews.author: Fly Fishing the World

customer_reviews.title: Caddis men's waders
customer_reviews.text: after two years I finally realized why my right sock was always wet, the Caddis waders leak on the right side, somewhere above the knee area. It is a shame because otherwise they are good. I only used them maybe 20 to 30 times, for 2 hours a time max. I am going to stick with the more known brands. THese are my first waders.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Warm, dry, and good fitting
customer_reviews.text: "Attractive"? Well, if you find men looking portly in a pair of waders "attractive," all rightie then. But, seriously, these are a bit more "sporty" than many competitors. The fit is JUST right! Warm and dry, just like they should be. I stood in late spring mountain water (=cold!) for two hours at a time and never felt a chill. Would buy again i a heartbeat! No reason to buy exorbitantly priced waders. These are VERY nice, and not just "for the price," either.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Spector

customer_reviews.title: Did not like, returned
customer_reviews.text: These are built well and will probably hold up and do the job. I didn't like the fit (they run way big), I didn't like the big logo on the chest, and I didn't like the stiffness.
customer_reviews.author: Paperback Writer

customer_reviews.title: Big guy friendly
customer_reviews.text: XXL STOUT. I am 6'5" 320lb have an inseam of 32in chest of 53" boot of 14. These waders fit great been looking for awhile, only complaint is the inseam is a little short but not enough to send back or complain to much, plenty of room in the feet could fit a size 15 foot. Plenty of room all around chest and legs for a heavy jacket or layers of sweats
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Received wrong size
customer_reviews.text: Product looks good but I received the wrong size. I ordered a small and received a large. It is huge on me. I am very disappointed in Warehouse Deals, inc. for sending the wrong size since I am leaving for my fishing trip tomorrow and will not have waders.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: These waders are the cat's meow!
customer_reviews.text: These waders are the cat's meow! I'm 5'5", 220#. I bought the Large, Short, Stout, and the sizing is perfect. I also bought a "used, like new" from amazon.com for $82, and when they came in, they were new, package never seemed to have been open. The only problem, was I had to buy new wading boots, one size larger than my normal 9 shoe. These have thicker neoprene stockings than my old waders. I highly recommend these waders.
customer_reviews.author: edabq

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and breathable waders
customer_reviews.text: These are a well made set of waders. They are lightweight, and breathable as advertised. Run true to size, so plenty of room in them to be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable. Kept me warm and dry
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a steelhead fishing trip to Oregon. They worked perfectly. Super comfortable. Kept me warm and dry. Make sure you wear socks in the stocking foot. I wear a size 11 shoe so the neoprene was a little long but did not get in the way.
customer_reviews.author: AtillaSmokey

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyed them...
customer_reviews.text: Preformed well in their maiden trip down the Escanaba River. Stayed dry, mobility was real good. The excess in the booties caused some trouble buying boots online. I wear an 11.5 shoe and ended up having to return 2 pairs for boots and eventually end up with a size 14 boot. Once I had all that ironed out I was very pleased with these for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JHiggs

customer_reviews.title: The best value
customer_reviews.text: Have fished these over a hundred days and several years in tough rivers with thick brush and thorny vines. They are my light weight ”go to” waders. These are a very basic waders with none of the fancy features my high end waders have, but they get more use because they are lighter and cooler
customer_reviews.author: marc meyer

customer_reviews.title: Big Foot
customer_reviews.text: Purchased February 2016. Ordered size small and I wear a 9 shoe. Waders fit my body fine except the rubber boot is about 2 inches longer past the end my toes and too wide also. Makes for an uncomfortable fit inside boot.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Harry

customer_reviews.title: Ok, don't have the double insulation on the knees ...
customer_reviews.text: Ok, don't have the double insulation on the knees and not very thick... I will go back to the SIMMS.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Ewton

customer_reviews.title: Foot size and fit
customer_reviews.text: Returning Appears to be well made, went with large to accommodate my foot size 10 1/2 -11, had unacceptable time trying to get my foot past the ankle section, then gets foot into the sock that’s way too big and irregular shaped, then it was almost impossible getting my foot back thru the ankle section... Looking elsewhere....
customer_reviews.author: Guppy

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and comfortable but I do a lot of hiking and these ...
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and comfortable but I do a lot of hiking and these quickly leaked due to wearing thin along inside seams on both legs. Cannot expect much for the price but if you are going to walk much I would not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: 2muchfishinggear

customer_reviews.text: Got these for my father after our fishing trip and they were the only waiters that would fit his size he has a 54 inch waist roughly 350 pounds and these had room to spare definitely would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jaybe

customer_reviews.title: solid waders
customer_reviews.text: Have used these for more than a year now and probably aver 30 times fishing and they are holding up very well - no leaks. I hike in and out of a canyon through some brushy and thorny areas at my favorite fishing spot, but no leaks yet. I am 6' and thin, with a 30" waist and size 11.5 shoe and size large fit me well.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Spring and fall are great with just a pair of long-johns underneath
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for two seasons and they are still going strong. The only reason that I didn't give them 5 stars is that they offer no insulation except for your feet. In the summer, my feet sweat so much that I may as well just walk into the water. Spring and fall are great with just a pair of long-johns underneath. When there is ice, I wear two pairs of socks and extreme cold long-johns and I'm good for three hours or so. For the price, they can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made.
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’7 and got the regular. They ride the crotch a bit if the legs are pulled tight. Maybe the short version would fit a little better but it’s been a while since I got these and it’s not that big of a deal. Good waders though.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Leaking Seams
customer_reviews.text: The knee seems have begun leaking after only 20 days of fishing. They are comfortable for my build but who cares when durability is such a question. My window to return them has closed which is unfortunate. Good luck out there.
customer_reviews.author: michael riedy

customer_reviews.title: runs very small I was told i would have needed ...
customer_reviews.text: runs very small I was told i would have needed a medium short stout. I ended up after exchanging with a XL short stout. what ever size you thinking go 2 sizes bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Capuano

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: It's great. Have it a year now, I've beat it up, been through all terrain, has held up well, sturdy. Feels comfortable, not tight, not too baggy.. im 5'7 (I tell the ladies I'm 5'9 shhh).. and the fit is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Made hunting in Alaska easy. Light and flexible. Just wore thermal long johns underneath. Kept me dry and warm.
customer_reviews.author: UnkaDan

customer_reviews.title: Great Waders
customer_reviews.text: Husband had to grab a new pair of waders after his Simms waders finally gave up, picked these up in LT he's 6'4" and 225lbs and they fit perfectly, didn't leak on our recent vacation and he wore them 3-4 times. He likes them a lot and for the price, if they last a few years we'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Caddis mens wadersmaremwoth the money.
customer_reviews.text: These Caddisnwaders work great for me. I fly fish about a dozen times per year and have usednthem for one year so far. Theybhave heldmup well with no leaks. Good value fornthe money.
customer_reviews.author: DJCP

customer_reviews.title: Look Great, Fit Great, and Last
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of waders from Caddis. The last pair lasted a for 3 or 4 years, and had lots of use, and abuse. I just tried on my new pair last night and went down fishing below my cabin. The fit is great I'm tall, but not fat, so the sizing I like. I think I had Tall medium, and it fits great. These are built well. I believe they are made in Oregon, and I like that. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Copper King, MT

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a x-large which I returned because they were about foot to tall they reached my nose not my chest. I re-ordered a large size and I was very disappointed that they are about the same size. I now have to return them.
customer_reviews.author: graham r.

customer_reviews.title: LEAKING WADERS = RASH & FUNGUS
customer_reviews.text: Waders are part of the uniform for bank anglers. Yet, when I want to get into the water to get closer to the action, the right leg of my Caddis waders fill with river water. Last trip was a bear with icy water, skin rash and toenail fungus. Called your supplier only to get transferred to the wrong department. Does anyone know what their doing? Thanks Caddis!
customer_reviews.author: Wen Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Low Cost Low Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Purchased December 2015. Stopped using August 2016 and went back to my cheep hodgeman bucket waders that I've had for ten years... Pros- Looked to be decent quality and comfortable. Thin in the legs Generous in the chest Light weight Low cost Cons- Gravel cuff not secure gathers a lot of water in swift currents No belt loop Sholder straps easily migrate off shoulders Taped seams delaminates resulting in leaks
customer_reviews.author: Johnny H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: My new waders are amazing! They are light and watertight. Very well made and a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Techanic

customer_reviews.title: Great waders
customer_reviews.text: Work great, they are a little large but aren't too bad after tightening the elastics. They do what they're supposed to and have lots of useful pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: good waders
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with these waders. It's hard for me to find waders to fit and these are perfect. The only thing I don't like is the dark section on the legs isn't totally welded to the waders and creates a space for water to collect underneath, so before I take them off or get into the vehicle, I have to make sure the water is out of this area. No leaking though. The front flap could come up just a couple of inches higher but this isn't a deal breaker for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: I think this may have been a little better with an extra few inches
customer_reviews.text: These waders fit well as I have a larger upper torso and shorter legs (29" inseam, 6ft tall). The only issue for me personally would be that they were a little snug in the crotch area and I have no way of extending the shoulder straps further. I think this may have been a little better with an extra few inches. I have yet to try them out in the water so once I do, will further update.
customer_reviews.author: Big Vik

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you dry
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves it have bought him three.he uses for work because he has to go into the water sometimes. The reason have had to buy him so many is the type of work he does is construction and that would cause them to eventually get ripped on something but as far as keeping you dry it does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie C.

customer_reviews.title: Better fit options
customer_reviews.text: Caddis offers more custom sizes than other brands. I got the medium short stout and it fits better than I thought it would. A 45" chest with a 27" inseam is hard to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice so far
customer_reviews.text: I have used these once and they were comfortable and waterproof. Hope they last.
customer_reviews.author: GARY S....

customer_reviews.title: Size really did not match the fit as suggested. ...
customer_reviews.text: Size really did not match the fit as suggested. I'm 5'10" about 215lbs. I got a large and they fit snug. They will work for warm weather, but nothing where you need to have additional clothing on. I'd suggest a XLRG with anyone my size with a 10.5 to 11 shoe size.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Roe

customer_reviews.title: Holds Up to Tumbles in the Streams
customer_reviews.text: They fill the need. I have taken a few tumbles while walking the streams and these held up well. I would suggest that you think getting a larger size because the leg openings are tight. I am 5'9" and 172 lbs. A medium regular fit OK but the leg opening by the calf were very tight, however a medium stout worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: The Sorensen Family

customer_reviews.title: I love these things!
customer_reviews.text: I've never tried waders before... man was I missing out! I bought the regular 2XL size because I'm 6'2", 270 lbs... turns out, they are quite large and I probably could've gotten away with the XL. But I like my clothing bulky, so I decided to keep them. The stocking feet on them are a little large too and make my boots fit a little snug... but it's something I can live with. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sharkbait

customer_reviews.title: I am 6' 250lbs and well proportioned. I bought ...
customer_reviews.text: I am 6' 250lbs and well proportioned. I bought a XXL Stout and they fit perfectly. Fished two days back to back in the rain and the waders dried overnight (8hrs) with no problem just hung them upside down in my hotel room. I fished in the rain for 12 hours straight in the rain and never felt a drop of rain. Can't wait to see how they hold up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Jreese

customer_reviews.title: If you looking for big waders this is the one!
customer_reviews.text: These waders was awesome!! I'm a big guy and I need big waders and this one was perfect it fit very well and one of the best features in my option is the little strap that tightens around your armpits when I slipped in a hip high part of the creek I went under but it kept the water out and all I had to do was switch jackets.
customer_reviews.author: SOLO_BUDDHA

customer_reviews.title: To short
customer_reviews.text: Sizing was odd. Really need to exaggerate your inseam, Amazon’s return is great
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These waders keep the wet stuff out...
customer_reviews.text: I like these waders and they fit just fine. I wear out a pair of waders each and do not think these will last any longer than a more expensive pair. It would be nice if the wading belt had a better latch, this type loosens when walking (think Velcro Caddis). Next time I order waders I will be sure it includes wading belt loops as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lefty

customer_reviews.title: Large size
customer_reviews.text: Great set of waders, finally found waders that fit. Factory rep was wonderful and helpful and ultimately resulted in my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bmriggs

customer_reviews.title: At first seemed to be a good pair of waders
customer_reviews.text: At first seemed to be a good pair of waders, but after minimal use the neoprene booties developed holes in the heels.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E Varner

customer_reviews.title: Great first use... More to come!
customer_reviews.text: So far met all my expectations, have only used/worn them once float tubing all day, which meant I did not use my wading boots. I wore wool sucks underneath and had plenty of room while not feeling uncomfortable with flippers on, the top you can cinch up well so no water gets in while your posture gets lazy while floating. I am 6' 1" 185 pounds and the large fits perfectly. Will edit my review once I do some serious wading this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great waders!
customer_reviews.text: These waders are exceptional quality for the price. They're breathable and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.text: They fit well, though does not have a true foot size, which is okay, it is just inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie

customer_reviews.title: Waders worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I have not had these waders long enough to make a full review. I would want to have them for at least a year if not two to verify that they do not leak too easily. So far, after using them twice, so good. The one problem I have is getting my feet into the feet of the waders. Difficult, which takes time to both put on and take off. Otherwise, I like the waders.
customer_reviews.author: Barry T. Cuda

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and not too baggy even though I sized ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well so far. Good fit and not too baggy even though I sized up due to my long legs. Nothing a belt can't fix
customer_reviews.author: Adam Killham

customer_reviews.title: Size not as described Disappointed Husband really wanted want to wear them
customer_reviews.text: Size not as described Disappointed Husband really wanted want to wear them. Not made for shorter people with larger abdomens. Returned
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent waders.
customer_reviews.text: These are top quality waders. I took them to the mountains of WV and traversed many streams with zero issues. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: These do the job well - keep my dry and fit in my wading boots. Done and done.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT product for a noob to fishing
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT product for a noob to fishing. the double stiched knees are perfect for those times you may have to kneel on the river rocks. i love the mesh pockets and zippered stash pocket. even the slip-thru hoodie style pockets are useful! great deal.
customer_reviews.author: T. C.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: So it seems like good quality, but I received the waders with two broken buckles. I will update this review upon receipt of a new set of waders.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Saenz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the XL long size to fit my frame. I'm 6"3 225 and the fit was near perfect. I wear a size 13 shoe but the feet where just a little too big. I should still be able to fit a pair of wader boots over them but that's my only complaint. They held up very well in the water. I wore these for an overnight fishing trip and these where breathable enough to stay cool in the sun but also warm enough for night fishing. The belt in the picture was kinda useless considering its just a strap that doesn't connect to the waders themselves. Over all these are great for the price and I'm in love already.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Love Caddis gear
customer_reviews.text: These things are great. I passed along an older pair, 1 level down from these, and me and my nephew are both very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Colsrob

customer_reviews.title: Good waders for those bigger around guys
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of my neoprene waders in warm weather they were too hot. It is hard to find waders for us larger round guys that are not 6.5 ft tall and these fit me well.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Scot

customer_reviews.title: Great wader.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5' 11", 170 lbs, and wear 34-32 pants. The medium fit me perfectly. These are very comfortable. A great product for the price! I've only fished in them about 10 times, but so far they are as good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: work very well
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up last year to go fly fishing in Yellowstone. I was initially worried about durability (me slipping/rubbing on rocks, bumping branches/trees) so far not a single issue. They are thin, but so far have held up without issue.
customer_reviews.author: R. Patience

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: Good fit, good quality. Can't go wrong with this wader - especially for the money. I own a pair of Orvis waders and gave these to my sons as a gift. the quality of these waders is not much below my Orvis brand.
customer_reviews.author: Joefred

customer_reviews.title: Nice Looking and Appear Well Made But Slight Leaking
customer_reviews.text: These waders are nice looking and appear to be well made but I am having problems with them leaking. I have returned two pairs now because of a small leak in the upper right leg seam. The leak is fairly minimal but results in the pants I am wearing underneath them to become damp after several hours of use in my float tube.
customer_reviews.author: Carlisle

customer_reviews.title: Nice Wader
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of stocking foot waders. Very comfortable. I'm 6'3" and was able to walk without feeling any hang up in crotch from pant leg length. I called Caddis and spoke with customer service rep and she helped me figure out the correct size . . . she was supper. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Doug63026

customer_reviews.title: Good waders to start with but after 3 days of ...
customer_reviews.text: Good waders to start with but after 3 days of fast moving water waste deep my pants underneath were wet, and there was about 2 inches of water in my booties.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgang

customer_reviews.title: GREAT WADERS!!
customer_reviews.text: These waders are great quality! My husband had this pair which lasted for over 3 years and he used them frequently. They did so well that I had to buy the same pair again. If it's not broke, don't fix it... :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Other than a small tear in the boot flap that I got from a barbed-wire fence (not the waders' fault) that doesn't affect the water-proof-ness of these waders, they've been great. Super comfortable and I haven't had any leaks after about a dozen uses in three different states.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Clapper

customer_reviews.title: Very functional
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect for the water. Lightweight warm and functional.
customer_reviews.author: Dette Friedrichs

customer_reviews.title: solid
customer_reviews.text: I like these waders very inexpensive and functional, I have not owned them very long so reliability is still a big question mark, everything I have read from other sites suggests these waders do hold up to repeated use.the fit was just about perfect for the size I selected. When these guys wear out I will buy another pair. You just can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: so good. Got them last week
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Got them last week. I am 6' 200lbs, average frame. Ordered XL and they fit perfect, plenty of room to move around without being the least bit baggy. I were a size 11 boot and the sock was fine. They look great, feel great, lightweight and breathable. Most important, I have used them three times so far and no leaks. Very happy with these waders.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Thiessen

customer_reviews.title: They work great
customer_reviews.text: Second pair I've owned from Caddis. They fit great and keep the water out. Buy them, you'll like them too! Thank you Caddis.
customer_reviews.author: will caffrey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and customer support!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase. Waders worked just as advertised and a good buy! It would be nice if they had belt loops built into the waders for the belt that came with the waders. I greatly appreciated the support from Mike and Lisa when making sure I selected the right size.
customer_reviews.author: JWP

customer_reviews.title: Price is good for the quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought for duck hunting. Price is good for the quality. They have normal amount of pocket space. I will buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Joey S.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality -Need better QC before shipping out.
customer_reviews.text: Used in Alaska Rt foot leaked out of box, by day 3 both feet leaked. Remote fly-in and had to wear for 7 days.
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Fishermen

customer_reviews.title: Right for an occasional angler
customer_reviews.text: Not the best quality but it's just right for an occasional angler like me
customer_reviews.author: Juan Yanez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Value for Weekend Fishermen
customer_reviews.text: Tighter in the legs than many other style of waders, but still comfortable. Held up well during my four day trip to the San Juan river in NM. I was waist deep much of the time and had no issues with leaking, even after I poked my thigh with a hook.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch & Jen

customer_reviews.title: Nice pair of waders
customer_reviews.text: Nice pair of waders. One seam started to pull out but I returned the pair and received new ones very quickly. Attractive is in the mind of the beholder I guess - these look decent, certainly better than my old ones but I wouldn't wear them to a prom.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J.

customer_reviews.title: good luck getting over your ankle
customer_reviews.text: Decent waders. Bought it from Amazon about a year ago. Only problem is the ankle area is way too tight. If you wear these in the winter and have more than one pair of socks on, good luck getting over your ankle. I am a medium build guy (5 ft 7 160 lbs) so it isn't because i have weird big ankles or anything either. Otherwise, a good wader with a sub par belt.
customer_reviews.author: Cheap Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great Waders!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these waders in September. I have fished about six times in them and they have been dry (and warm) every time. I'm 6'1" and weigh 230 lbs. I ordered the Large size based on Caddis' fitting chart on their home page (using my shoe size). The fit is a little tighter than my old waders, but still comfortable. The X-large size would have just been too big. The waders come with a wading belt, a repair kit, and a mesh storage bag, though I don't use the bag...I hang my waders up in the closet after they're dry. There is also a nice front pocket where I can slide my reading glasses in and out of, as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Gary H. Arrington

customer_reviews.title: lightweight, good-looking, and great value
customer_reviews.text: I've only used these waders once, but my initial impression is very favorable. They were extremely comfortable, and the utility pockets in the front were handy and spacious. I also liked the heavy-duty plastic D-rings in the front because I was able to clip my fishing tools to them while fishing from a kayak. The knees are reinforced on these, which also came in handy when kneeling in shallow water around sharp oyster shell reefs. My only possible issue was that the neoprene feet in these are huge on me (about a men's size 8.5 foot - these are closer to 11 or 12) so I have to roll the toe up onto itself before putting on my wading boots.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie L. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: They are also much more comfortable than neoprene waders
customer_reviews.text: Well Into my second season with these and I love them. They've held up great. Well constructed, no leaks, and comforable for all-day fishing in high water in hot and cold weather. I'm really happy I switched from all neoprene to these.
customer_reviews.author: MATT

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME BUY
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME!! I was super impressed with these waders when they showed up. I think they are the best pair you can get for around $100 bucks. I've been super happy with them. Have recommended and would keep recommending again!
customer_reviews.author: Baylie Jones

customer_reviews.title: He said he liked them.
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses these for brook fishing. He said he liked them.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: bigger than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Nice waders. They were a little bigger than I was expecting. Order 1 size down.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Great Waders!
customer_reviews.text: Best fitting waders I have ever owned, and a great price too. I really researched these, because I don't replace waders very often. I can not wait for trout fishing season to begin. Very good quality and workmanship.
customer_reviews.author: DeeAnn

customer_reviews.title: Great for ministers who need to baptize without getting wet.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a pastor and I use these while I'm baptizing. They work great!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Mclain

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us. Leaked after 3-4 uses...
customer_reviews.text: These started leaking after 3-4 trips to the mountain streams we go to... I don't know if that's to be expected... just know that these didn't work for us too long and that we'd never buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: RJ D

product_meta.title: Caddis Men's Attractive 2-Tone Tauped Deluxe Breathable Stocking Foot Wader(DOES NOT INCLUDE BOOTS)
product_meta.description:
STOCKINGFOOT DELUXE BREATHABLES
Caddis Stockingfoot Deluxe Breathables are the ultimate in lightweight design. They're ideal for those days when the mornings are cool and the days are long and hot. This product is the perfect all-around breathable wader.

View larger THE ULTIMATE IN BREATHABILITY
The secret behind Caddis breathable wader technology is our CaddisDry fabric. CaddisDry fabric's waterproof, breathable layer will not allow water molecules to pass through and enter the waders - however, it does this while still allowing smaller vapor molecules to exit. With no build up of moisture within the waders, you'll stay comfortable in all seasons.

AT A GLANCE
 * Attractive 2-tone taupe color
 * Heavy-duty polyester material
 * CaddisDry breathable technology
 * Reinforced knees
 * Attached gravel guards
 * Seams taped, glued, and stitched
 * Foot taped inside and out
 * New quad pocket
 * High-density neoprene soles

SAFE WADING TIPS
Always keep these two rules in mind when wading in any body of water: wade with caution, and wade with care. There are obvious and not-so-obvious dangers inherent with wading. Following these tips will help you experience a safe and enjoyable trip. 

 * Use a wading staff to feel the bottom before stepping.
 * Never wade alone.
 * Always wear waders that fit properly.
 * Wear a wading belt to create a seal between your body and the wader.
 * In rivers and streams, identify potential dangers down current such as waterfalls, log jams, or undertows before entering the water.
 * Walk slowly, smoothly, and carefully.
 * Wear a personal floatation device.
 * Be aware of tides, currents, and water level changes.
 * If you fall, don't panic. Don’t fight the current, work with it. Allow the current to drift you downstream as you work your body towards the bank.
 * Never continue wading if your waders are full of water.

BREATHABLE WADER KEY FIT POINTS - MEN
Size Max Inseam Max Girth Max Foot Small 32" 43" 9.5 Medium 33" 45" 10.5 Large 35" 48" 11.5 XLarge 36" 51" 12 XXLarge 37" 55" 13 Medium Stout 33" 50" 10.5 Large Stout 35" 54"11.5 XLarge Stout 36" 57" 12 XXLarge Stout 37" 64" 13 Medium Tall 36" 45" 10.5 Large Tall 37" 47" 11.5 XLarge Tall 38" 51" 13 For short stouts subtract 3" from the inseam.
feature_bullets: Made in the USA or Imported
Comfortable 2 Tone Taupe stocking foot Breathable waders with double knee's, adjustable deluxe suspenders, new Quad pocket and attached breathable gravel guards.
Works great in all weather conditions to keep you warm and comfortable while fishing, clamming or working in your pond.
We use only the highest quality breathable material with a durable Poyester outer using CaddisDry technology that allows perspiration through, but keeps water out.
The feet are double taped glued and stitched to make sure your feet stay warm and dry. Boots should be purchased separately.
Refer Indications section below for help in selecting size. For short stouts subtract 3" from the inseam.
This family of waders has more adult sizes than any other wader series in our line. Men and women of most body sizes are addressed here.
